title: Why toilets are a feminist issue (and no, women can't use urinals)
text:
On a recent trip to the theatre, I faced a binary choice familiar to many women: enjoy a drink at the bar during the interval, or spend the entire 15 minutes in the queue for the toilets. If nature calls, it’s not really a choice at all, but rather something to which we simply grow resigned, accustomed as we are to long waits to use public conveniences. Longer waits (we can’t help but notice) than those faced by our male counterparts.

Merely a mild irritation - or actually something more serious? Discussing “the tyranny of the toilet queue” on Emma Barnett’s BBC Radio 5 Live show this week, the feminist campaigner Caroline Criado Perez made a spirited and well-founded argument for why toilets...
